newsitem.title: UK: European cotton markets quiet, selective buying.
newsitem.headline: European cotton markets quiet, selective buying.

text.p: Most markets in Western Europe remained quiet although spinners in Germany, Italy and Portugal in particular bought central Asian and African franc zone medium to better qualities selectively against known autumn requirements, industry sources said.

In Eastern Europe, markets generally lacked feature and in the long staple sector, the fine trade was of insignificant proportions pending the start next month of first new crop export sales by Egypt.
